SEOKeywords.data: Digital Magazine, Digital Edition, e-replica, e publishing, digital publishing software, eMag, PageFlip, 3dissue, 3D Issue

value010.data: Tanzanian agriculture professionals learned how to build a chimney solar dryer during a workshop on reducing postharvest losses of tomatoes, mangoes, carrots, amaranth, green beans and other crops.
Participants in a postharvest training in Bangladesh set up a chimney solar dryer to dry sliced vegetables.
In Guinea, participants in a postharvest training collect dried sliced fruits and vegetables, including mango and okra, from a test run of the UC Davis-designed chimney solar dryer.
Bun Sieng uses a "CoolBot" for cold storage of vegetables in her shop in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. The vegetables are produced by farmers who don't use pesticides.
Technicians Sel Rechaney and Ry Saren work with a women's cooperative in Cambodia's Siem Reap province that is using a CoolBot to keep the produce fresh before selling.
Phong Suret and Pak Ry of the Beng Melea farmers' cooperative build a new vegetable packinghouse, with a CoolBot-enabled cold storage room, near Siem Reap in Cambodia.
Farmers with Nsongwe Women's Association in Zambia tend to vegetables like spiderplant in a Horticulture Innovation Lab project taking place in Zambia, Kenya and Tanzania.
In a UC Davis-managed Trellis Fund project for organic vegetable producers in Kenya, Belinda Richardson, Olivia Atieno Nyaidho and Onyango Vincent harvest amaranth in a demonstration garden.
As UC Davis students working with the Horticulture Innovation Lab, Emily Baker and Robert Duggan transplant African and Asian varieties of vegetables at the campus demonstration center.

Studying abroad in the Community, Technology and Sustainability seminar in Nepal, UC Davis students talk with Jonathan London, associate professor in human ecology's community and regional development program.
"The beautiful garden in Kungsträdgården: a must go-to park in Stockholm." –Julia Hoffman ('20, Environmental Policy and Analysis and Planning)
"Beautiful view of the waterfront in Monaco on a day trip from Nice, France." –Kaitlyn Rosso ('18, Managerial Economics)
"Refurbished old fishing bridge. Northern Ireland." –Kaley Marie Allchin ('21, Animal Science)
"A Konik foal at pasture at the Roztocze National Park, Poland." –Rebecca Moore ('21, Animal Science)
"After a restless day of exploring around South Korea's Jeju Island, kayaking along this hideen picturesque scenery is the perfect way to relax." –Amy Zhu ('19, Human Development)

"Paro Taktsang (Tiger's Nest) is a Bhutanese monastery situated on the upper cliffs of the Paro Valley. We had to hike about three hours to reach this sacred site." –Jason Ly, ('18, Environmental Science and Management)
"Davis students find a familiar face in a foreign landscape–Costa Rica." Shannon McCoy ('19, Wildlife Conservation Biology/Theatre and Dance)
